alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Grafton, northwestern Belknap and northwestern Merrimack Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Plymouth, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laconia, Franklin, Meredith, New London, Plymouth, Grafton, Gilmanton, Canterbury, Holderness, Ashland, Danbury, Belmont, Bristol, Andover, Alexandria, Center Harber, Hill, Bridgewater, Hebron and Northfield. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 53 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
